sub_title: Coaching for Academics, Professionals, PhDs &  students  |  Effortless Coach  | Transformational Life & Career Coaching  |  Hypnotherapy  |
summary:
Empathetic and Empowering Life Coaching & Hypnotherapy. I work with professionals, academics, PhD candidates, students and anyone who wishes to change their personal circumstances. I am a firm believer that our thoughts and words create our realities. A new positive thought can entirely change the way you see the world and serve as the catalyst that propels you forward with ease and grace.
I have been fortunate enough to help people making those shifts and move forward into a place where they feel confident, inspired and empowered.

Coaching and Mentoring:
Reinvent Yourself
PhD/Master Happitude
Career Coaching
Personal Leadership Coaching
Burn-out Coaching
Life Coaching
Emotional & mental blocks

projects.title: PhD Thesis ‘Experience the City: Analysis of Space-Time Behaviour and Spatial Learning’
projects.description: The work of mine PhD thesis is focused on understanding how individuals interact and learn about the urban environment. The main objective was to understand the dynamics of the learning process and collect longitudinal data over several weeks about interactions of individuals with the environment. The major methodological contribution of the thesis is developing the technology for collecting and interpretation GPS data about individual interactions. The results of the analysis suggest that individuals possess different learning styles and activity space profiles.

contributors.headline: Coaching for Academics, Professionals, PhDs &  students  |  Effortless Coach  | Transformational Life & Career Coaching  |  Hypnotherapy  |

projects.title: Master Thesis ‘Transit Space: Transformation of Public Space in Post-Socialist Russia from an Urbanism of Network Point of View’
projects.description: In my Master Thesis I researched the impact of social and economic transformations after 1989 on the spatial distribution and quality of public spaces in several industrial Russian cities. I explored what makes public spaces liveable and design a Patterns Handbook that consisted of strategies (design patterns) for successful transformation of public spaces in Russian cities. Applying strategies from the Patterns Handbook I developed a transition scenario for public spaces in Kemerovo city.

profile_positions.title: Central PhD Officer & PhD Advisor (EUR-wide)

profile_positions.description:
I coordinated the Leadership Programme (Honours Programme) for talented students seeking extra challenges; I organised masterclasses, society-oriented projects, provided extensive coaching and training in different areas related to personal leadership and group dynamics.  

I provided extensive personal guidance to the students on their study planning, academic performance,
personal leadership, group dynamics, study-related decisions, priority-setting, dealing with
study-related problems and pressure.

I fostered meaningful relationships among students through students field-trip retreats, team-work
society-oriented projects.

I taught courses with focus on active learning techniques and student engagement based on flipped classroom and problem-based learning (PBL) approaches. As a tutor I was involved in diverse Academic Skills Courses, Leadership Studies, Humanities, Social and Life Science.

In summer-autumn 2018 I took a position of the interim chair of the Programme Committee and worked to ensure the high quality of the educational programme at EUC, communicated and provided results and updates to the Executive and Management Committee.
profile_positions.title: Academic & Study Advisor | Coordinator of the Honours Programme | Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
After completing my PhD degree, since 2013 I have been coaching students and PhD candidates, helping them to find study-life balance and successfully finalise a thesis.

During 2013-2015 I travelled in Europe and lived in UK. I studied at a consultancy and business school on motivational psychology and goal-oriented thinking; successfully accomplished coaching training.
profile_positions.title: Student & PHD Coach & Mentor | Academic Advisor

profile_positions.description: I coordinated the Urban Nexus Project; the project focused on governance and service provisioning of the nexus of water/energy/food in deprived areas in Kampala (Uganda). I travelled to Kampala and ensured a smooth initiation of the project and cooperation between different research groups and external partners (Wageningen University (NL), Makerere University (Uganda), Kampala Capital City Authority (Uganda), The National Water and Sewage Corporation (Uganda), NGO Actogether Uganda).
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher, Social Sciences Group

profile_positions.description: I coordinated a LEAN management project that focused on optimisation of working processes and cooperation. I worked on a sustainable business policy, analyzed sustainable business practices and their implementation. My main activities included preparation of risk analysis reports for different business lines.
profile_positions.title: Coordinator LEAN Management / Business Lines Analyst

company.name: Eindhoven University of Technology, Department Urban Sciences | Design and Decision Support Systems

profile_positions.description:
I consulted and coordinated a project between TU/e Urban Planning Group and UK Department of Transport aimed to identify the advantages of using GPS technology instead of pen & paper method for the National Travel Survey in the United Kingdom. My activities included the communication with the UK Department of Transport on the process of data collection with GPS technology, the coordination of the processing of GPS data to ensure the delivery of the project in time and assistance in the preparation of the final report. 

I also consulted and collaborated in a project on collecting activity-travel data with GPS technology of 400 households in Rotterdam and Eindhoven. I consulted the involved partners (NTS Nipo and MarketingBytes) on the development of a system and a web application for GPS data collection, tested the system and assisted in producing technical manuals for study participants. 

As a Vice-chair of the 4 years European Project Cost Action TU0804 ‘Survey Harmonization with New Technologies Improvement’ I was involved in the preparation of the final report. During 2009-2013 years I assisted the Chair of the Action in developing the annual agenda of the Action, organization of meetings, budget planning and reports assessment.
profile_positions.title: Project Coordinator / Strategy Consultant / Researcher

profile_positions.description:
I studied how individuals interact with the urban environment and how this affects the formation of their knowledge about the city. To collect information about individuals’ interaction I independently carried out data collection with GPS technology.  I designed algorithms for the development of the software TraceAnnotaor. TraceAnnotator processes GPS data uploaded to a web server by the survey participants and computes using Bayesian belief network travel agendas and behaviours of participants (used transport modes car/bike/etc, visited location, activity types, time information). I analysed data using a combination of quantitative and qualitative methods and visualization techniques. 

I also gave practical seminars ‘Research Skills’ for undergraduate students in Dutch language. Additionally, during these years I assisted my supervisor in organization and coordination events and scientific conferences.
profile_positions.title: PhD Researcher / Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description: I carried out from beginning to end a project aimed to identify the trends of spatial development of the region Parkstad Limburg during the last century and determine spatial causes of shrinking of the region last decades. Main activities included analysis of the maps and spatial data, preparing visual materials and development of spatial interventions to overcome the negative aspects of shrinking.  I prepared the final booklet with the maps and results of the project that were presented at the Symposium Shrinking Regions at the Delft University of Technology.
profile_positions.title: Internship Spatial Planning Consultancy
